intro: Karpatiosorbus slovenica, commonly known as the Carpathian barbed hawthorn, is a shrub native to the Carpathian Mountains. It belongs to the family Rosaceae and is characterized by its thorny branches and clusters of white flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife. It thrives in rocky and forested areas, often growing at elevations between 800 and 1,500 meters. Its ornamental value and ecological significance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
